The Relationship between Short-Term Forward Rates and Spot Rates
The idea here is that borrowing for three years at the 3-year spot rate, or borrowing for oneyear periods in three successive years, should have the same cost. The S; are the current spot
rates for i periods.
This relation is illustrated as (1 + S3)3 = (1 + S)(1 + lyly)(1 + 2yly). Thus, S3 =
[(1 + S)(1 + lyly)(1 + 2yly)]1/3 – 1, which is the geometric mean return we covered in
Quantitative Methods.
